is the input sheet for penalties not subject to deﬁciency procedures and is the source document used by CCP to make penalty assessments. This form may also be used to abate previously assessed penalties. A separate Form
is required for each tax period and penalty code section. One Form

cannot be used to assess penalties under different code sections, even if all penalties are to be assessed against the same tax period. Multiple assessments of penalties with the same reference number for the same entity and period must be consolidated as a single assessment. The excise employee will complete the following: a. Line

- Taxpayer’s Name: Enter the name against whom the penalty is to be assessed. DO NOT ENTER JOINT NAMES for individuals even if a joint return is ﬁled. - MFT: Check the box that corresponds with the information on the Name/TIN line, individual (IMF) or business (BMF). d. Line
- No Statute: Check only if no statute exists. e. Line
- Year: MANDATORY COMPLETION. Use the period which the act or failure occurred. separate Form
is required for each period involved. f. Line
- Statute Date: For late ﬁled returns, calculate the

year period of limitations date. g. Line
